title.narrative: SUPPORT TO VULNERABLE CHILDREN

description.narrative: Reducing Social Inequities: By end-2020, the social protection system is ready to provide inclusive quality community-based support services., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection â€“ General, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Economic And Social Policy General, Human Rights Institutions, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Reducing Social Inequities:By end-2020, the social protection system is ready to provide inclusive quality community-based support services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Reducing Social Inequities: By end-2020, the social protection system is ready to provide inclusive quality community-basedsupport services.

description.narrative: During the reporting period, the national report to CRC was submitted, mid-term review of the National Action Plan on Child Rights was conducted and the capacity on ;;monitoring child related cases of the Office of Ombudsperson (OO) was enhanced. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:26/01/2021

title.narrative: Degree of Development of the Quality Assurance System for Social Work

baseline.value: Criteria (Criteria (i) Normative frameworks Score 1: There is no normative framework Criteria (ii) System of supervision and support Score 1: There is no system Criteria (iii) System for licensing/accreditation of social work Score 1: W

title.narrative: Piloting of provision of additional social support services is started in 2 locations(54252)

target.value: 2020:Social work practice is initiated in selected etraps of Turkmenistan and initial plan for social services scale up is available

actual.value: 2020:Social work practice initiated in 20 etraps across all velayats and the capital with 45 social workers hired and trained.

title.narrative: Availability of an adopted child rights monitoring framework as part of the (currently) draft National Plan of Action on Child Rights (NPAC) (Yes/No)(54251)

baseline.value: Draft framework available as part of the draft NPAC

target.value: 2020:A mid-term assessment of the NPAC is initiated linked to an improved and easy-to-follow indicator framework

actual.value: 2020:A mid-term assessment of the NPAC was conducted, where proposed indicator framework was discussed and follow-up actions agreed

title.narrative: The Ombudsman Office establishment and functioning to do ?quality monitoring on child rights(54261)

baseline.value: The office of the Ombudsman is established in 2016 but has no capacity to address child rights issues

target.value: 2020:The Ombudsman Office capacity is strengthened in terms of (1) Access to Justice, (2) monitoring of child care institutions, (3) child rights promotion at the sub-national level and (4) CRC reporting, including alternative reporting.

actual.value: 2020:The capacity of OO were strgthened in Juvenile Justice, on the role of OO during COVID, alternative reporting
